page.title: 04HOYLAKE COTTAGE HOSPITAL
page.content:
This was a National Health Service hospital until closed in 1983. As a result of local concern, a trust was formed to administer the hospital. Appeals were launched to raise funds and the hospital was registered as a charity and re-opened in 1985.
The hospital offers residential care for 12 geriatric patients, 10 elderly people with mental disorders and 8 ambulant handicapped people. Physiotherapy and occupational therapy are available for residents. There is an X-ray department, a chiropodist, and a Day Centre for 25 handicapped or house-bound persons.
The hospital is attended by local doctors, has a large nursing staff and over 200 voluntary helpers.
